data.title: Opened editors: selection not updating in all cases properly
data.body:
Start empty. Press Cmd+1 to open the first editor and then Cmd+2 for the second. The second is not getting selected:

![editors](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/15804098/687c7c2a-2afd-11e6-9fc0-230337e582f4.gif)

data.title: VS code never opens again after crashing on opening large files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a large minified javascript file (1MB+).
2. Search for some function name which is located nearly the bottom of the file
3. Now VS code stops responding (may be trying to colorize the code/syntax, but takes too much time).
4. From task manager, force close code with end process tree (Process with command line: code.exe -n)
5. If not reproducible, repeat steps 1-4 a couple of times more.

VS code does not opens ever again. Clearing temp files or re installing the VS code will not work. No error logs in temp or windows event viewer.

Additional info:
- H/W config: Core2 Duo 2.1GHz, 3GB RAM (To check performance)
- Installed extensions:

benjaminromano.typings-installer-0.1.1
dzannotti.vscode-babel-coloring-0.0.4
eg2.tslint-0.5.23
HookyQR.minify-0.2.0
johnpapa.Angular2-0.4.4
ms-vscode.csharp-0.3.7
samverschueren.yo-0.8.4
vsmobile.cordova-tools-1.1.1
warren-buckley.iis-express-0.0.3

Is atom editor compatible with VS Code projects?

data.title: Backspace does not handle certain emoji correctly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Version: 1.2.0-insider
Commit: 7ccb21d7e7256a7d42f3dda8b2d3721b8e59724f

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Type an emoji such as "💩".
2. Delete an emoji character using [Backspace] key.
3. You can see only a half of the character is deleted.

Interestingly, cursor move, [Delete] key work correctly with the character.

![remove-poo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1311400/15802553/e0a846a0-2af0-11e6-89cd-8ec36b5f42b8.gif)

data.title: StringEditorInput cache of DebugService is seriously flawed
data.body:
the debugStringEditorInputs cache in DebugService has the following serious problems:
- the source content is always requested from the debug adapter so there is no need for a cache,
- cache hit is determined by uri, but correct and available new content is ignored and stale content is returned instead,
- cache is not cleared when the debug sessions ends,
- cache is unbounded.

Found this when debugging https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/7117

data.title: Color emoji support
data.body:
It seems, at least on Windows, VS code does not show emoji characters in color even with fonts like "Segoe UI Emoji".
Is this just a mis-configuration? Or, if not supported, do you have any plan to support color emoji?

I'm on:
1.2.0-insider
7ccb21d7e7256a7d42f3dda8b2d3721b8e59724f

data.title: Terminal as tab
data.body:
Hi
It would be great to have ability to open terminal as code editing tab. Or to be able to open several terminals (actually only one open terminal it is rare case ;) )

data.title: Launching from the command line fails when the file path has a space in it
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. In the windows command line, in a folder with a space somewhere in its file path
   (like `C:\Users\me\My Website`), 
   try to open VSCode using the batch command `code %cd%`.
2. A new instance of VSCode will open up with two new documents, one called "My" and one called "Website", or however many spaces were in the filepath.

data.title: "Change All Occurrences" could be limited to the variable's scope
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0 Insider

This may just be an opinion, but would appreciate if you could consider this feature.

The "Change All Occurrences" currently works as a simple find and replace, 
it would help workflow if a similar option existed for only changing variables with same name and scope.

Thanks for the great software. 👍

data.title: Debugger start failing. Not recognizing launch.json file.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows, OS X, Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a new app or open an existing one.
2. Hit F5 to start debugger.

When no `launch.json` file exists VSCode creates it but then refuses to recognize it and start the debugger.

This buggy behavior is noticeable when at start you press F5 from anywhere but the Debugger. If you navigate to the Debugger and hit F5 it works and then VSCode remembers it.

Note: VSCode 1.1.1 works.

2. alt+shift+RightArrow

works for me in other language modes, but not in HTML

data.title: CSS color previews stopped working
data.body:
Version 1.2.0-alpha
Commit dacf99d41fbf3929b00af685b5a985d6f2d9542d
Date 2016-06-02T20:55:38.297Z
Ubuntu 16.04

I was fiddling with rgba colors and it stopped working.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/15799116/030a3180-2a07-11e6-97a7-cbc464d8339f.png)

Console:

data.title: Tabs: Make the editor title area a richer control
data.body:
Both with tabs enabled or disabled, the title area should become a richer area where you can:
- drag it to move the editor around
- right click to open a context menu with editor specific actions (pin, move, close others)

data.title: Quick open: make editors of different kinds distinguishable

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently we show all kinds of editors in one quick open list (editor, diff editor, preview). This can make it hard to find the right one so we should play with showing icons in the list to distinguish them.

data.title: Store editor view settings per group and not per file
data.body: An editor can be opened in multiple groups and each should store its own view state.

data.title: Decorate matching results in the error list
data.body:
When we allow to filter a list by searching we typically highlight the matching portions like this:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/15798120/683d813e-2a2e-11e6-8e79-340f2e4a23dd.png)

I suggest we do the same for the error list. We have widgets that help with the decoration, see:

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/quickopen/browser/commandsHandler.ts#L330

and

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/parts/quickopen/browser/quickOpenModel.ts#L544

data.title: Finding in problems does not expand nodes
data.body: When I search for problems we do not expand collapsed nodes automatically but we should.

data.title: Middle Click (or Scroll Wheel Click or Shift + Click) should open new window.
data.body:
On Windows (and Ubuntu with Unity Desktop Manager), clicking on a taskbar item with the scroll wheel button, middle mouse button, or shift + click causes a new window to be opened instead of an existing instance. VS Code does not do this.

Repro: 
1. Open VS Code and open a folder.
2. Click the VS Code icon using the scroll wheel click.

Expected: A new VS Code window will open

Actual: The existing VS Code window is shown.

data.title: Reset skip flag to false to fix skipping rest of string
data.body:
This PR fixes a regression introduced in ef537b0aabb7933184340418b64284cdcd162320.

Please review, @jrieken.

data.title: "Select All Occurrences" is not selecting all of matches in large files (stops at 1000)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a 3MB file with some repeating text at each line (`The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog`
2. Highlight a word such as `quick`
3. Do a multi-cursor select (CMD+SHIFT+L)
4. Edit `quick` to say `slow`
5. Notice that not all lines were changed :( (stops at line 999 of a 35,397 line file)

data.title: Bug with replacing repetitive code inside of folding text
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Mac OS X El Capitan

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Fold code that contains repeating text (E.g. "repeating.text") inside of "[{a:_.function(repeating.text) { } }]
2. Now use the ctrl+shift+l shortcut to replace all instances of repeating.text
3. You will notice that the changes within a few of the folded regions are applied in a very strange way, often breaking the code.

(I searched for 'replace all inside of folded code' before posting this and couldn't find anything).

data.title: Tasks: Unhandled SASS 'error' event ends task
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1
# Error Generated:

[15:11:26] Using gulpfile c:\Angular2\angular2-quickstart\gulpfile.js
[15:11:26] Starting 'sass'...
[15:11:26] Finished 'sass' after 14 ms
[15:11:26] Starting 'default'...
[15:11:26] Finished 'default' after 14 ms
[15:11:30] Starting 'sass'...
[15:11:30] Finished 'sass' after 4.66 ms
events.js:141
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^
Error: bog.scss
Error: Invalid CSS after "h1": expected "{", was ""
        on line 1 of bog.scss

> > h1
> >    ^
> >     at options.error (c:\Angular2\angular2-quickstart\node_modules\node-sass\lib\index.js:271:32)

Watching build tasks has finished.
Steps to Reproduce:

Please note the tasks.txt file is really tasks.json and gulpfile.txt is gulpfile.js
[tasks.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/298345/tasks.txt)
[gulpfile.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/298347/gulpfile.txt)
1. Ctrl-Shift-B started task
2. Created empty file called bog.sass
3. Entered h1 - error immediately came up.  In fact the second I enter any text into an empty .sass file the error displays and the task terminates.

If this is any help, this used to work.  The other day I was running into an angular-cli problem so in the course of trying to figure that one out I upgraded my version of node from 4.2.4 to 4.4.5 and that indeed fixed THAT problem.  I may now have caused this problem.  Not sure.  I'm a bit confused about the version of node that Visual Studio code uses (5.10.0) and what I see when I run node-v on the command line which shows 4.4.5.

I'm in an experimental phase in CSS precompilers with VS Code so in the short term I've moved to LESS and that seems to work fine.

data.title: VS Code does not warn/report when file behind loaded buffer is changed on disk

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1 (1.1.1)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5 (15F34)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Edit file in VS code
2. Open file in a different editor
3. Edit and save in different editor
4. Go back to code in VS file
### Expected

VS Code prompts me with "File has been changed on disk, do you wish to reload the file?"
### Actual

VS Code does not give any indication that the file on disk is different than whats in the editor.

data.title: Proposal: Ability to search only through specific directories
data.body:
Just throwing the idea out there (it might already be something upcoming), but it'd be a great feature to be able to search only specific folders (like most editors / atom etc can).

Sometimes when looking for a specific file, let's say `index.ts`, it can look through so many directories. 

Let's say you know you're looking for something `import { Whatever }` and you know it's in `/modules/things` someplace, at the moment there is no way to achieve this, without looking through absolutely everything.

data.title: File Type column in the File Explorer on Windows shows "Visual Studio Code" rather than the actual file type
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try to open a file (any extension: xml, html, js, cpp, etc.). Windows prompts for default way to open the file. Choose Visual Studio Code
2. The file explorer now shows the file type being Visual Studio Code in the Type column.

The problem with this is that it's impossible to know what file is what since the extension of the file is hidden. The only way to know is to open the file or run ls in the terminal.

![unknown_file_types](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13036301/15787035/7b491ca6-2985-11e6-9827-f6be40b7f79f.PNG)

![vscode_file_list](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13036301/15787043/8f1adf80-2985-11e6-9819-a90f4c9c135f.PNG)

When registering the files to use Sublime Text by default, the file types are shown in the Types column in the file explorer as shown in the following picture.

![sublime_file_types](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13036301/15787100/fc1bdecc-2985-11e6-86a6-86d0c3454540.PNG)

data.title: Feature Request: add option to disable suggestions in comments
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1 commit def9e3
- OS Version: Windows 10

I would like to suggest an option to be able to disable suggestions from showing up while typing in a comment. I find it distracting and very seldom useful. Perhaps an "editor.quickSuggestionsInComments" setting?

data.title: Can not run npm in integrated terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.2 insider
- OS Version: windows 10 insiders
- node - 6.2.0
- npm - 3.8.9

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open integrated terminal
2. type `npm -v` or `npm start` or just `npm`
3. `npm` throws errors

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2758540/15786304/972566b6-29c4-11e6-8de8-ad184a75ff4d.png)
